NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSImagingReportHeader 0..*BaseImging Report header (model)
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
subject 1..1EHDSPatientA.1.1 - Subject
healthInsuranceAndPaymentInformation 0..1BackboneElementA.1.4 - Health insurance and payment information
healthInsuranceCode 0..1IdentifierA.1.4.1 - Health insurance code
healthInsuranceName 0..1stringA.1.4.2 - Health insurance name
healthInsuranceNumber 0..1IdentifierA.1.4.3 - Health insurance number
intendedRecipient 0..*Reference(Patient (model) | Related person (model) | Health professional (model) | Organization (model) | Health professional role (model) | Device (model))A.1.5 - Intended recipient
author 1..*EHDSHealthProfessionalRoleA.1.6 - Author
attester 0..*EHDSHealthProfessionalRoleA.1.7 - Attester
legalAuthenticator 0..1EHDSHealthProfessionalRoleA.1.8 - Legal authenticator
documentMetadata 1..1BackboneElementA.1.9 - Document metadata
documentId 1..1IdentifierA.1.9.1 - Document ID
documentType 1..1CodeableConceptA.1.9.2 - Document type
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): LOINC

documentStatus 1..1CodeableConceptA.1.9.3 - Document status
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): hl7:CompositionStatus

period 0..1PeriodA.1.9.4 - Period
reportDateAndTime 1..1dateTimeA.1.9.5 - Report date and time
documentTitle 1..1stringA.1.9.6 - Document title
eventType 0..*CodeableConceptA.1.9.7 - Event type
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): LOINC, SNOMED CT, dicom-cid-33-Modality


specialty 0..*CodeableConceptA.1.9.8 - Specialty
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT


reportCustodian 1..1EHDSOrganizationA.1.9.9 - Report custodian
documentFormat 0..1CodeableConceptA.1.9.10 - Document format
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 Document Format Codes

confidentiality 0..1CodeableConceptA.1.9.11 - Confidentiality
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): hl7:Confidentiality

language 0..1CodeableConceptA.1.9.12 - Language
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): ISO 639

version 0..1stringA.1.9.13 - Version
studyInstanceUid 0..*uriA.1.9.14 - Study Instance UID
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): OID


accessionNumber 0..1stringA.1.9.15 - Accession number
presentedForm 0..1EHDSAttachmentA.1.10 - Presented form
media[x] 0..*A.1.11 - Media
mediaHttps://www.xt-ehr.eu/specifications/fhir/StructureDefinition/EHDSAttachmentEHDSAttachment
mediaHttps://www.xt-ehr.eu/specifications/fhir/StructureDefinition/EHDSMediaEHDSMedia

name: EHDSImagingReportHeader
title: Imging Report header (model)
description: A.1 - EHDS refined base model for Imaging Report header data elements

element.definition: A.1 - EHDS refined base model for Imaging Report header data elements
Patient/subject information

element.short: A.1.4 - Health insurance and payment information
element.definition: Health insurance information (Health insurance information is not always required, however, in some jurisdictions, the insurance number is also used as the patient identifier. It is necessary not just for identification but also forms access to funding for care.)

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Unique health insurance company identification code
Full, official name of the healthcare insurance provider.
Number or code under which the insured person is registered at the insurance provider.
Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable
Author by whom the document was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.
Attester who validated the document. Mulitple attesters could be provided.
The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document
Data relevent to document type and its content for administrative and searching purposes.

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Unique identifier of the document
Identifies the type of document at hand, e.g. Hospital discharge report.
The status of the Hospital discharge report. E.g., preliminary, final.
Time of service that is being documented
Date and time of the report creation.
Document title, such as "Hospital discharge report", "Laboratory Result Report" etc..

Categorization of an "event" covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of event types depends on the use case and agreement betwen data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purpuses.
Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)
Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the report [this element will include organisation ID, name, address etc., as other elements describing organisations].
An identifier of the document constraints, encoding, structure, and template that the document conforms to beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.
Level of confidentiality of the document. Implicit value is normal.
Language in which the document is written. Language is expressed by the ISO language code.
Version of the document

Unique global identifier(s) that identifies an imaging study upon which the imaging report is based.An identifier that links an imaging report to one or more imaging studies. This element is relevant for the interactive selection of the available studies.

This is an identifier, managed by the RIS at the local level, which usually uniquely identifies an imaging procedure request, and links it to imaging study(ies) and related imaging report(s). As it is prefixed by the registration authority it is a globally unique ID, usable both nationally and cross-border.
Entire report as issued  pdf format recommended
Media attachments.
